paper_abstract: The Chow parameters of a Boolean function f : {-1, 1}(n). {-1, 1} are its n + 1 degree-0 and degree-1 Fourier coefficients. It has been known since 1961 [Chow 1961; Tannenbaum 1961] that the (exact values of the) Chow parameters of any linear threshold function f uniquely specify f within the space of all Boolean functions, but until recently [O'Donnell and Servedio 2011] nothing was known about efficient algorithms for reconstructing f (exactly or approximately) from exact or approximate values of its Chow parameters.
paper_title: Nearly Optimal Solutions for the Chow Parameters Problem and Low-Weight Approximation of Halfspaces
